meanings.definition: A person or thing that marks.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to be the markers on the map during the geography lesson.
meanings.sent2: She used colorful markers to highlight important points in her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The markers on the soccer field were the players themselves, running back and forth.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was a marker of his true character.
meanings.sent5: The old lighthouse served as a reliable marker for sailors navigating the rough seas.

meanings.definition: A writing implement used for drawing or making marks.
meanings.sent1: The children used markers to color in their drawings.
meanings.sent2: She grabbed a marker to write her name on the label.
meanings.sent3: The markers in the art class were running out of ink, making the drawings look faded.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like markers, leaving a lasting impression on everyone who heard them.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully selected her markers, ensuring vibrant colors for her masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A sign or indication of something.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were a marker of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: His sudden silence was a clear marker of his discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The missing page in the book was a sneaky marker left by the mischievous cat.
meanings.sent4: The first snowfall was a marker of the beginning of winter.
meanings.sent5: The smile on her face was a marker of her happiness.
